text: the athlete Bianca Williams is
considering legal action against the
Metropolitan Police alleging that they
racially profiled her when she was
stopped with her partner driving in
London on Saturday the couple had their
three-month-old baby in the car when
they were stopped searched and
handcuffed by police Scotland Yard says
the driver sped off when asked to stop
and that there was no concern about the
officers conduct our home editor mark
Easton has the story police in North
London stopped a Mercedes and demand the
occupants both black that's the voice of
Bianca Williams a gold medal-winning
British sprinter her distress is obvious
as officers demand she leave her
three-month-old baby in the back of the
vehicle along with her partner
Portuguese sprinter Ricardo dos Santos
the young mum after research both are
released without arrest
I tried to pull myself back into the car
because I've got a baby like my mind
that my mother instinct kicked in and
I'm not leaving my son in their car he's
a baby and they were just so aggressive
and they didn't know if it many disagree
Ms Williams currently trains with former
Olympic champion Linford Christie who
tweeted angrily was it the car that was
suspicious all the black family in it
the matter was raised at a virtual
meeting of Parliament's Human Rights
Committee today they have one perception
in their mind all the time but if you're
black you must be up to something every
day it saddens my heart to see these
video nasties of police officers but a
whisker away of smashing screens in
front of a black person's face would
that happen to a white family the
independent office for police conduct
says it's making inquiries ahead of any
formal investigation however Scotland
Yard says it's reviewed the video as
well as pictures from officers body worn
cameras and is satisfied there are no
miss
conduct issues the labor leader Kearse
Tama a former Director of Public
Prosecutions believes there are still
troubling questions to answer I don't
know what led to the stop in the first
place but what I do know is that if I
was a senior officer looking at that
video footage I would feel uncomfortable
about the way that it was dealt with
police in London have dramatically
increased the use of stop and search
during the lockdown period hoping to
disrupt the activities of violent drug
gangs in the last three months there
have been more than a hundred thousand
stop and search operations carried out
in the capital in the year to June more
black people were stopped than whites
which means proportionately black people
are four times more likely to be stopped
the black lives matter protests
highlighted the disproportionate use of
stop and search against black people but
the Commissioner of the Met Cressida
dick has said that she's not going to
pander to some new public opinion and
insist stop and search is a vital tool
in the fight against crime
I'd say it's my normal which is horrible
to say it's it's normal because happens
for many times something needs to happen
and you know we have to make a change
mr. dos Santos says he's been stopped on
at least 15 occasions driving the same
car but this time a video has gone viral
and the questions are refusing to go
away mark Easton BBC News Scotland Yard
